010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018
019
020/**
021 * This class defines static methods for working with CIE-XYZ color space.
022 * @author WB
023 */
024public abstract class CieUtil {
025        
026        private CieUtil() {}
027        
028        /**
029         * Calculates the XYZ coordinates for a given point (x,y) in the CIE
030         * xy-color diagram. XYZ is located on the 3D plane X + Y + Z = 1.
031         * Returns (0,0,0) for y = 0;
032         * @param x x-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
033         * @param y y-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
034         * @return the associated XYZ coordinate
035         */
036        public static double[] xyToXYZ(double x, double y) {
037                return xyToXYZ(x, y, 1.0);
038        }
039        
040//      public static double[] xyToXYZ(double x, double y) {
041//              if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
042//                      return new double[] {0, 0, 0};
043//              }
044//              else {
045//                      double Y = 1;
046//                      double X = x * Y / y;
047//                      double Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y;
048//                      double mag = X + Y + Z;
049//                      return new double[] {X/mag, Y/mag, Z/mag};
050//              }
051//      }
052        
053        public static float[] xyToXYZ(float x, float y) {
054                return xyToXYZ(x, y, 1.0f);
055        }
056
057//      public static float[] xyToXYZ(float x, float y) {
058//              if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
059//                      return new float[] {0, 0, 0};
060//              }
061//              else {
062//                      double Y = 1;
063//                      double X = x * Y / y;
064//                      double Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y;
065//                      double mag = X + Y + Z;
066//                      return new float[] {(float) (X/mag), (float) (Y/mag), (float) (Z/mag)};
067//              }
068//      }
069        
070        /**
071         * Calculates the XYZ coordinates for a given point (x,y) in the CIE
072         * xy-color diagram, with Y explicitly specified.
073         * @param x x-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
074         * @param y y-coordinate (in the 2D xy-diagram)
075         * @param Y the Y-coordinate (in 3D color space)
076         * @return the associated XYZ coordinate
077         */
078        public static double[] xyToXYZ(double x, double y, double Y) {
079                if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
080                        return new double[] {0, 0, 0};
081                }
082                else {
083                        double X = x * Y / y;
084                        double Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y;
085                        return new double[] {X, Y, Z};
086                }
087        }
088        
089        public static float[] xyToXYZ(float x, float y, float Y) {
090                if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
091                        return new float[] {0, 0, 0};
092                }
093                else {
094                        float X = x * Y / y;
095                        float Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y;
096                        return new float[] {X, Y, Z};
097                }
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Calculates the 2D (x,y) color diagram coordinates for 3D XYZ color 
102         * coordinates (X,Y,Z).
103         * 
104         * @param XYZ the XYZ coordinate (3D)
105         * @return the xy-coordinate (2D)
106         */
107        public static double[] XYZToXy(double[] XYZ) {
108                double X = XYZ[0];
109                double Y = XYZ[1];
110                double Z = XYZ[2];
111                double mag = X + Y + Z; 
112                return (Arithmetic.isZero(mag)) ? 
113                                new double[] {0, 0} : new double[] {X/mag, Y/mag};
114        }
115        
116        public static float[] XYZToXy(float[] XYZ) {
117                double X = XYZ[0];
118                double Y = XYZ[1];
119                double Z = XYZ[2];
120                double mag = X + Y + Z; 
121                return (Arithmetic.isZero(mag)) ? 
122                                new float[] {0, 0} : new float[] {(float) (X/mag), (float) (Y/mag)};
123        }
124        
125        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
126        
127
128        // Poynton (ITU 709) 
129        public static final double[][] Mrgb65i = 
130                {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
131                 {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
132                 {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
133        
134        
135        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ. */
136        public static final double[][] Mrgb65 = Matrix.inverse(Mrgb65i);  // (R,G,B) = Mrgb * (X,Y,Z)
137        //from sRGB specs:
138//      {{3.2406255, -1.537208, -0.4986286},
139//       {-0.9689307, 1.8757561, 0.0415175},
140//       {0.0557101, -0.2040211, 1.0569959}};
141        
142        // Poynton (ITU 709) 
143//              {{ 3.240479, -1.537150, -0.498535},
144//               {-0.969256, 1.875992,  0.041556},
145//               { 0.055648, -0.204043,  1.057311}}; 
146        
147        // D50 from sRGB specs, most accurate for desired tristimulus X = 0.9642, Y = 1, Z = 0.8249 (https://www.color.org/sRGB.pdf)
148        public static final double[][] Mrgb50i = 
149                {{0.436030342570117, 0.385101860087134, 0.143067806654203},
150                 {0.222438466210245, 0.716942745571917, 0.060618777416563},
151                 {0.013897440074263, 0.097076381494207, 0.713926257896652}};
152        
153        // see book Eq. 14.49 (p. 443)
154        public static final double[][] Mrgb50 = Matrix.inverse(Mrgb50i);
155        
156        
157        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
158        
159        public static void main(String[] args) {
160                PrintPrecision.set(15);
161                System.out.println("Mrgb50i = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb50i));
162                System.out.println("Mrgb50 = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb50));
163                
164                System.out.println("------------------------------------");
165                
166                System.out.println("Mrgb65i = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb65i));
167                System.out.println("Mrgb65 = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb65));
168                
169                System.out.println("----- Approximation of Mrgb50 by Bradford adaptation----------");
170                
171                BradfordAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
172                double[][] Madapt = catD65toD50.getAdaptationMatrix();
173                double[][] Mrgb50X = Matrix.multiply(Mrgb65, Madapt);
174                double[][] Mrgb50Xi = Matrix.inverse(Mrgb50X);
175                System.out.println("Mrgb50Xi = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb50Xi));
176                System.out.println("Mrgb50X = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb50X));
177                
178                System.out.println("------------------------------------");
179                double[][] Mrgb50_65 = Matrix.multiply(Mrgb65i, Mrgb50);
180                System.out.println("Mrgb50_65 = \n" + Matrix.toString(Mrgb50_65));
181        }
182}
